info.title: B2C Commerce Developer Sandbox REST API
info.description: B2C Commerce provides a REST API to manage developer sandboxes. The API allows you to create, manage, and delete developer sandboxes.

get.description: Return information about the user interacting with the API.

200.description: Metadata about the authenticated API user.

get.description: Returns information about the system, the user is interacting with.
Returns information about the system, the user is interacting with.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Additional information, which should be shown in the realm query. Available options are: [configuration,usage, accountdetails].

400.description: The ID is not a valid realm ID.

403.description: The user doesn't have access to the realm.

404.description: There isn't any realm with that ID.

get.description: Return the current configuration values of the realm.

200.description: Current configuration values of the realm.

400.description: The ID isn't valid or the configuration isn't valid.

403.description: The user doesn't have access to that realm.

404.description: There isn't any realm with that ID.

patch.description: Update the customizable configuration of a realm. Note that the internal time format in weekday schedules is [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Times).

400.description: The ID isn't a valid realm ID.

403.description: The user doesn't have access to that realm.

404.description: There isn't any realm with that ID.

get.description: Return information about the realm's usage.

403.description: The user doesn't have access to the realm.

404.description: There isn't any realm with that ID.

post.summary: Show usage information for given realms.
post.description: Update the customizable configuration of a realm. Note that the internal time format in weekday schedules is [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Times).

requestBody.description: Return information for given all realm's usage

400.description: The ID isn't a valid realm ID.

403.description: The user doesn't have access to that realm.

404.description: There isn't any realm with that ID.

get.description: Return all sandboxes of a realm.

parameters.name: filter_params
parameters.description: If passed in supported format, returns sandboxes that matches the query. Supported format: realm=zzzz&state=active&resourceProfile=medium&createdBy=user1&tags=[tag1,tag2,tag3].

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (bad request).

403.description: The user doesn't have access to that realm.

404.description: There isn't any realm with that ID.

post.description: Create a new sandbox within the realm.

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (bad request).

403.description: The user doesn't have access to the realm.

404.description: There isn't any realm with that ID.

500.description: There were server errors initiating the sandbox deployment.

get.description: Return details on a specific sandbox in a realm.

200.description: Details on the sandbox (including its state).

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (bad request).

403.description: The user doesn't have access to the requested realm.

404.description: There isn't any realm with that ID.

200.description: Updated details on the sandbox (including its state).

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (bad request).

403.description: The user doesn't have access to the realm.

404.description: There isn't any sandbox with that ID.

delete.description: Delete a specific sandbox in a realm.

202.description: The request for deleting the sandbox has been accepted by the API server. This doesn't mean that the sandbox has already been deleted, since the actual deletion process does not necessarily start immediately and might take a while. You can track the deletion process using sandbox GET requests.

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (bad request).

403.description: The user doesn't have access to that realm.

404.description: ID not found.

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (bad request).

403.description: The user doesn't have access to the sandbox.

404.description: There isn't any sandbox with that ID.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all past and present operations on a sandbox within the realm.

403.description: The user doesn't have access to the realm or sandbox.

404.description: There isn't any sandbox with that ID.

get.description: Retrieves a dedicated alias for the sandbox. Can be called without authentication to get cookie values for the alias.

403.description: The user doesn't have access to the realm or sandbox.

404.description: There isn't any sandbox or any alias with that ID.

delete.description: Deletes a dedicated alias configuration for a sandbox.

202.description: Shows, that alias currently gets deleted.

403.description: The user doesn't have access to the realm or sandbox.

404.description: There isn't any sandbox or any alias with that ID.

post.description: Request an operation on a sandbox within the realm.

requestBody.description: Operation to be carried out on a sandbox.

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (bad request).

403.description: The user doesn't have access to the sandbox.

404.description: There isn't any sandbox with that ID.

422.description: The operation isn't allowed in the current state of the sandbox.

500.description: There were server errors during the operation.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all past and present operations on a sandbox within the realm.

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (bad request).

403.description: The user doesn't have access to the sandbox.

404.description: There isn't any sandbox with that ID.

500.description: There were server errors during the operation.

get.description: Return details of a sandbox operation that was recently submitted, is currently in progress, or has already finished.

200.description: Details of the sandbox operation's state and the state of its target.  If the operation has already finished, indicates whether the operation was successful.

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (bad request).

403.description: The user doesn't have access to the requested operation or sandbox.

404.description: There isn't any sandbox or realm matching the given parameters.

get.description: Return all settings of the sandbox.

403.description: The user doesn't have access to the requested sandbox.

404.description: There isn't any sandbox matching the ID.

403.description: The user doesn't have access to the requested sandbox.

404.description: There isn't any sandbox matching the ID.

get.description: Return information on sandbox storage capacity for a currently running sandbox.

403.description: The user doesn't have access to the requested sandbox.

404.description: There isn't any sandbox matching the ID.

realmParam.name: realm
realmParam.description: The four-letter ID of the realm.

pageParam.name: page
pageParam.description: The page to access in a paged response. Page numbers start with '0', which is the default value.

perPageParam.name: per_page
perPageParam.description: Count of elements on a page. The default value is '20'.

fromParam.name: from
fromParam.description: Earliest date for which data is in the response. Thirty days in the past by default. Format is ISO 8601.

toParam.name: to
toParam.description: Latest date for which data is included in the response. Today's date by default. Format is ISO 8601.

sortOrderParam.name: sort_order
sortOrderParam.description: Order of the list. Default value is ''asc''.

sortByOperationParam.name: sort_by
sortByOperationParam.description: Field by which to order the list. By default, the list is not ordered.

operationStateParam.name: operation_state
operationStateParam.description: State of operations included in the response. By default, all operations are included.

operationStatusParam.name: status
operationStatusParam.description: Status of operations included in the response. By default, all operations are included.

operationTypeParam.name: operation
operationTypeParam.description: Type of operations included in the response. By default, all operations are included.

detailedReportParam.name: detailedReport
detailedReportParam.description: Field to check whether detailed report is to be retrieved, by default detailed report will not be pulled

granularityParam.name: granularity
granularityParam.description: Granularity of usage to be included in the response. By default, granular usage is not returned.

AccountManager.description: Authenticate using Commerce Cloud Account Manager with your SSO credentials.

ClientCredentials.description: Authenticate using Commerce Cloud Account Manager with your client credentials.

code.description: Response code sent along with the status.

status.description: String with value 'Success' or 'Failure' to indicate request outcome.

perPage.description: Maximum count of elements per page.

first.description: Relative link to the first page.

previous.description: Relative link to the previous page. 'null' if the current page is the first page.

next.description: Relative link to the next page. 'null' if the current page is the last page.

last.description: Relative link to the last page.

id.description: GUID of the realm in the system.

name.description: Human-readable four-letter ID of the realm.

enabled.description: Flag indicating whether the realm is enabled for any operations.

activeSandboxes.description: Number of currently active sandboxes for a realm.

ConfigurationIntegerValue.description: Object that holds an integer-based configuration property. A zero value means "unlimited".

fixedValue.description: Fixed value for this configuration property. You can't use this along with a maximum or default value.

WeekdaySchedule.description: A schedule definition for a dedicated time on specific weekdays.

weekdays.description: List of weekdays, where the action should take place

time.description: Time (with timezone) where the action should take place on the specified weekdays. Time format is [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Times). If no time zone is given, the timezone defaults to GMT.

RealmSandboxConfigurationModel.description: Configuration object related to sandboxes of a realm.

limitsEnabled.description: Flag indicating whether sandbox specific limits are enforced for the realm.

totalNumberOfSandboxes.description: Total number of sandboxes (regardless of state) that the realm can hold.

localUsersAllowed.description: Flag indicating whether users outside the Account Manager are allowed.

RealmSandboxConfigurationUpdateModel.description: Update data for configuration data related to sandboxes of a realm. The time formats within the weekday schedules have to be passed in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Times) format.

RealmRequestConfigurationModel.description: Configuration object related to requests targeting the sandboxes of a realm.

enforced.description: If enabled, rate limiting is active.

maxRate.description: Maximum requests allowed per time period.

timePeriod.description: Number of seconds during which to count requests.

realmName.description: GUID of the realm in the system.

id.description: GUID of the realm in the system.

accountId.description: account/SFID of the realm in clusterstate table or org62 Tenant table

createdSandboxes.description: Total number of sandboxes created during the requested timeframe (by default, the previous 30 days).

activeSandboxes.description: Total number of sandboxes active during the requested timeframe (by default, the previous 30 days).

deletedSandboxes.description: Total number of sandboxes deleted during the requested timeframe (by default, the previous 30 days).

sandboxSeconds.description: Total number of seconds sandboxes ran during the requested timeframe (by default, the previous 30 days).

minutes.description: How many minutes sandboxes of this profile type were running during the report timeframe.

minutesUp.description: Sum of minutes sandboxes in this realm were running during the requested timeframe (by default, the previous 30 days).

minutesDown.description: Sum of minutes sandboxes in this realm were not running during the requested timeframe (by default, the previous 30 days).

to.description: Time the sandbox was stopped. If the sandbox is still running, this value will not exist for the last block.

detailedReport.description: Field to check whether detailed report is to be retrieved, by default detailed report will not be pulled.

SandboxStorageModel.description: Shows all filesystem storages and how much space is left on them.

StorageUsageModel.description: Represents a single filesystem storage unit with its available space.

percentageUsed.description: Used space in percent, compared to total space.

enabled.description: Flag indicating whether the sandbox is enabled for any operations.

versions.title: SandboxModelVersions
versions.description: Versions of the components that make up the sandbox.

autoScheduled.description: Defaults to false. If set to true, the sandbox is covered by automatic start/stop actions, which can be set to a dedicated time via realm- configuration API.

analyticsEnabled.description: Defaults to false. If set to true, analytics will be enabled in ODS.

deletedAt.description: Time when the delete operation was created.

deletedBy.description: User who requested the sandbox deletion.

links.description: Set of named links for accessing the sandbox.

bm.description: Fully qualified URL of the sandbox Business Manager web app.

ocapi.description: Fully qualified URL of OCAPI data API (excluding version selector).

impex.description: Fully qualified WebDAV URL for accessing import and export files.

code.description: Fully qualified WebDAV URL for accessing code.

logs.description: Fully qualified WebDAV URL for accessing log files.

usageDate.description: start of the usage being returned

creditsUp.description: Credits consumed when sandboxes were up during the requested timeframe.

creditsDown.description: Credits consumed when sandboxes were down during the requested timeframe.

minutesUp.description: Minutes sandboxes were up during the requested timeframe.

minutesDown.description: Minutes sandboxes were down during the requested timeframe.

deletedAt.description: Time when the delete operation was created.

minutes.description: How many minutes sandboxes of this profile type were running during the report timeframe.

minutesUp.description: Minutes sandbox in this realm was running during the requested timeframe (by default, the previous 30 days).

minutesDown.description: Minutes sandbox in this realm was not running during the requested timeframe (by default, the previous 30 days).

autoScheduled.description: Defaults to false. If set to true, the sandbox is covered by automatic start/stop actions, which can be set to a dedicated time via realm- configuration API.:

SandboxResourceProfile.description: Determines the resource allocation for the sandbox, "medium" is the default. Be careful, more powerful profiles consume more credits.

unique.description: Define if it's a unique configuration

requestLetsEncryptCertificate.description: Request a valid certificate to be generated on the fly through Lets Encrypt. This action consumes certificate requests from the domain quota imposed by Let's Encrypt, please read the Alias documentation carefully.

sandboxId.description: The UUID of the sandbox the sandbox alias is pointing to.

cookie.description: The cookie required for each request to this alias.

registration.description: The link that can be used to save the required cookie for this alias in the browser.

domainVerificationRecord.description: The verification code to be added as TXT record in the DNS

status.description: The status of the alias creation process

sandboxSeconds.description: Total number of seconds during which the sandbox ran.

minutes.description: How many minutes sandboxes of this profile type were running during the report timeframe.

minutesUp.description: Sum of minutes sandboxes in this realm were running during the requested timeframe (by default, the previous 30 days).

minutesDown.description: Sum of minutes sandboxes in this realm were not running during the requested timeframe (by default, the previous 30 days).

history.description: List of blocks, which describe the separate uptimes of a sandbox

to.description: Time the sandbox was stopped. If the sandbox is still running, this value will not exist for the last block.

sandboxSeconds.description: Number of seconds that the sandbox was running for this block.

exceedsTimeframe.description: This property is set to true if the block exceeds the given timeframe and was therefore trimmed.

status.description: Indicates whether the operation finished successfully ('Success') or not ('Failure').

ttl.description: Number of hours the sandbox will live (must adhere to the maximum TTL quotas). If set to 0 or less, the sandbox will have an infinite lifetime.

autoScheduled.description: Defaults to false. If set to true, the sandbox is covered by automatic start/stop actions, which can be set to a dedicated time via realm- configuration API.

analyticsEnabled.description: Defaults to false. If set to true, analytics will be enabled in ODS.

ttl.description: Number of hours added to the sandbox lifetime (must, together with previous extensions, adhere to the maximum TTL configuration). If set to 0 or less, the sandbox will have an infinite lifetime.

autoScheduled.description: If set to true, this sandbox will be captured by automated start-/stop -management.

SandboxSettings.description: Map of additional settings evaluated when the sandbox is provisioned and initialized.

OcapiSettings.description: Use this document to configure Open Commerce API permissions for multiple client applications in the context of a single site.

items.description: Describes Open Commerce API permissions for a client application.
Configures resource specific permissions and settings.

methods.description: Open Commerce API HTTP method filter. For example, the filter ["get","patch"] allows access to the GET and PATCH methods for the specified resource path. You can specify methods that are supported for a resource. You can list all available resources and methods for the Shop API, version 18.1, with the following meta data call: http://{your-domain}/dw/meta/rest/shop/v18_1?client_id={your-client-id}

read_attributes.description: String that controls which properties are included in the response document. The configuration value must be specified using property selection syntax.

write_attributes.description: String that controls which properties can be included in the request document. The configuration value must be specified using property selection syntax.

resource_id.description: OCAPI resource identifier. For example: /products/*/images or /products/specific_id/images. This property supports Ant path style to describe resource IDs. You can specify wildcards or specific product IDs; you can also specify the pattern /products/** to access to all available sub-resources. You can list all resource identifiers for the Shop API, version 18.1, with the following meta data call: http://{your-domain}/dw/meta/rest/shop/v18_1?client_id={your-client-id}

version_range.description: Version range documents granting permissions only to a subset of OCAPI versions.

items.description: Use this document to grant resource permissions only to a subset of Open Commerce API versions. You can use the properties from and until to define the range. At least one of both must be specified.

from.description: From version (for example, 18.1). If you don't specify the from version, all versions including the oldest are accessible.

until.description: Until version (for example, 18.1). The until version is exclusive, which means that it is not part of the range. If you don't specify the until version, all versions including the most recent one are accessible.

WebDavSettings.description: WebDAV settings contain WebDAV client permissions for multiple client applications in the context of your organization. WebDAV client permissions enable you to configure which API clients can access your WebDAV files. These permissions also give you fine-grained control over which directories each client can access.

items.description: An array of client-specific permission documents.

client_id.description: Client ID indicating the API client for which the permissions are configured.

permissions.description: Array of directory-based permissions documents. Multiple permissions paths cannot intersect each other; for example, the following two paths intersect and are therefore invalid: /impex/src and /impex/src/foo.

items.description: Use this document to configure WebDAV permissions.

path.description: Directory for which the WebDAV permission is granted, including all subdirectories. File-specific permissions are not permitted.

operations.description: Array of operations granted on this directory. Possible values are read and read_write.

id.description: User's unique ID on Account Manager.
OAuth client ID used to retrieve the access token.

roles.description: User's roles as returned by Account Manager.

realms.description: Realms that the user is allowed to access. All sandboxes within these realms are accessible.

sandboxes.description: Sandboxes that the user is allowed to access.

region.description: The region, the system is deployed on.

systemIps.description: Public IP addresses of internal services like API server

sandboxIps.description: Public IP addresses of all sandboxes

status.description: String with value 'Success' or 'Failure' to indicate request outcome.

reason.description: Machine-readable, one-word, CamelCase description of why the operation failed. If this value is empty, there is no information available. The reason clarifies an HTTP status code but does not override it.

details.description: Extended data associated with the reason. Each reason can define its own extended details. This field is optional, and the data returned is not guaranteed to conform to any schema except that defined by the reason type.
